comments.commentBody: When a politician demonstrates that  "search for the truth" is not one of his ideals, then how can one trust anything that he says?
The NY Times, in its infinite kindness, is often glad to give its readers a chuckle in the morning. It is good to see the other side digging themselves ever deeper into that pile outside the barn.
Against Walker, Wisconsinites must stand strong. Vote this lightweight out of office.
Scott Walker apparently has two enemies in his sights: Washington; and the American people.  This Republican fetishizing of their ideology is not just evil.  It is sick.

Good to know that Scott Walker, favorite bought politician of the Koch brothers, wants to ignore popular protests in favor of the desires if his political enablers, sorry financial supporters.  Despite all that Koch money, this was the first of the Republican golden boys to fail to stop Donald the Trump's take-over of the Republican party.  I wonder who wrote this for him?  Scott, have you destroyed the University of Wisconsin yet?  Can't the NY Times find someone more credible to spout right-wing nonsense on their op-ed page?
If votes are to determine where this country goes with regard to the governor's ideas on states' rights.. he should take a clue from his rapid ouster during the primary.
... which is why a loose confederal system does not work and a federal system with transfer payments acts as a balancing force, keeping the nation together..

"...we did just that by taking on public-sector unions that had too much control over the government."

It takes millions of dollars to run for public office at the state and national these days and all that money ain't coming from the unions.

If you think that unions have more control over government than the Koch brothers and other ultra-rich who contribute much to political campaigns, you need to read the papers more often.

What influence did Koch brothers' campaign contributions have on you, Governor?

You do realize, Gov. Walker, that you are writing this for the NY Times and the Times readers have more than a passing familiarity with what's going on in the world than the talking points both parties put out. Right?

I have a suspicion Mary that conservative taxpayers outnumber liberal taxpayers.

Also, to be honest, some communities like blacks of Hispanics or Muslims do not share your liberal values. For instance abortion is banned or restricted in most of Latin America. Christianity in Africa is more conservative than Christianity in America. Gays in Islamic countries have far fewer rights, if any, than gays in America.

But because they are terrified of Republicans, these three communities tend to vote Democratic. They vote the same way you do but their values are not the same as yours.

How will they enter the national dialogue? Not through you. And not through the Republicans. They are little more than pawns.

"As I never tire of telling crowds, if Washington will get out of the way, we can help Wisconsinites, and make sure public assistance is a trampoline — not a hammock."

Mean is bad.

But mean and stupid is really bad.

The party is protesting because you are trying to govern without a mandate. You lost the popular election. Your policies have been proven time and time again to have failed. Sad. The idea that protesting is somehow a wrong response to misguided decision-making and corruption is a complete misread of what makes America great right now. It's the rising up that will save this place from corporate-sponsored, climate-denying, anti-woman, anti-union career politicians like yourself.

Dear Mr. Walker,
The American Civil War was fought over just such issues as you write about.
If it weren't for "Federal Intervention", slavery would still be the "law of the land' below the Mason Dixon Line. Even with the demise of the "peculiar institution", folks like yourself, and your cash laden band of cohorts, are still trying to "gerrymander" voting so that, guess what, Republicans would win!
I will hand it to you, you've got guts to write in the NYT one of Trump's sources of "fake news" and you have the temerity to suggest that the "United States" should be 50 separate, but equal, little dominions coming to the "Feds" only when they need disaster relief or to fight a war, a likelihood increased incredibly by the bunch now in charge.
'Public Assistance" is neither a hammock nor a trampoline but, in it's many guises, helps the poor and, judging by the tax code and tax breaks available, the very wealthy, the people your party by and large represents.
As usual, with everyone from the GOP, "public assistance" in the forms of tax shelters, parking profits overseas, generous 'tax breaks' to corporations, etc. receive not even a word in your "essay".
Mr. Walker, have you no shame?
Guess not.....

"Why does the NYT publish this kind of empty piece?"

It's red meat, and an easy meal at that. He's being shredded as we speak--a pulled pork sandwich for Times readers armed with reason and facts.
It's in the public interest to see how they think.
Know thine enemy.

Too bad Trump wasn't a teacher making $50K/yr. Then Walker would have taken him on with everything he had!  Seems who really intimidates Walker are billionaires.  He doesn't want to upset them.  Can't imagine why.

states rights?   what about the rollback of auto emissions reported in the NYTimes today.  not only does Trump want to roll back Federal standards (who needs clean air?) but Trump and the Republicans don't want to let California have its own stricter rules.  Once again states rights when it supports their far right agenda but otherwise not!

Stand how ever you want to stand Feret Face.
When your buddy Trumps tax returns are hacked a d posted we will see who protests.
We are legion.

You mention saving tax dollars and then also wasting tax dollars on drug testing?
Purely political and punitive stupidity. Red meat for the ignorant,
Here's an article tearing apart this ridiculousness, from that lefty mag, Forbes.
http://www.forbes.com/sites/judystone/2015/02/17/the-sham-of-drug-testin...

Ken, I'm so sorry that on your tourist visa trip to Washington you couldn't get your head around 'what's in it for Ken?' You couldn't imagine the synergy and complexity of 300 million Kens. The messy work of government aspires to insure Justice, Tranquility, general Welfare, and Liberty to you and all the other Kens, your fellow citizens. Most would like to just be left alone. Some squeak.  The ones with the most money squeak the loudest. They hire lobbyists, the "crowd that does all it can to maintain and expand the bloat." I humbly suggest Ken considers involvement in overturning Citizens United and getting at least some of the money out of the electoral process.
The good news is that here are two world leaders that understand each other. The bad news is that here are two world leaders that understand each other.

There are no words to fully explain the impact this letter has had on me, people, but I am sure Jason isn't about to rush in and get married again.   He needs compassion, friendship, hugs and love but probably not a wife...how could anyone top you, come close or even want to replace you.    Jason I am sure will move on when he is ready and with his attributes someone out there will fall in love with him and visa versa.   Your letting him free through the most awful circumstances and sadly as I know only too well its the people left behind that struggle for a very long time.   With every ounce of energy and strength you have left, love this man and leave him and your children with peace in their hearts.....Life will take care of itself.   Be brave. Jilly
Even if he does "rush" into something, I hope his choices aren't judged as harshly as that word implies.

This is so beautiful . I'm Japanese and English is my secound language and I dont speak English perfectly but your thoughtful beautiful letter just made me cry like I haven't cried for long time .
Your husband is lucky to have you as a wife and your kids are lucky to have a mother like you.

Your beautiful soul is forever here .
You made my day .

Thank you for sharing x
Kiss and hugs from Japan .

Gov. Walker is a mental midget dangling and squirming at the end of his puppet master's ropes.
Resist!

"Soros funded rent-a-mobs??????"

Seriously?

So, George Soros' money was behind the Women's March in Washington, which attracted somewhere in the vicinity of three times as many people as Mr. Trump's inauguration? Is that right? George Soros "rented a mob" of an estimated half-million people---to descend on the National Mall to protest the person and policies of Donald Trump? Is that right?

And the protests---large and small---occurring in large and small cities and towns across the country were funded by George Soros? Is that right?

Because it's just inconceivable to you that so many people would so dislike and distrust and have such disdain for Donald Trump---his person and his policies---that they would, of their own accord, show up to protest? Is that right?

You not only demean those who prefer something other than a narcissistic, pathological liar as president, you underestimate the strength of their convictions. One can only hope that you and your ilk will continue to underestimate the power of those who protested/protest. And will continue to delude yourselves with the idea that George Soros is able to mobilize such concentrated strength/power.

Given the history of your tribe, I suspect my hopes will be realized. If it is, we can, perhaps by the end of 2020, finally get rid of you and others like you who just can't stand the thought of sharing a piece of the (white) privilege pie with people who, well, aren't like you and don't want to be.
So an effort to tear the bubble by injecting alt-facts into the Times?
Another great reason to get out the vote in the midterms.
